div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.span: There are still openings for the Warsaw Elementary Universal Pre-Kindergarten program for the 2020-2021 school year. If you are a district resident and your child turns 4 on or before December 1, 2020, please call the Warsaw Elementary School Main Office at 786-8000, ext 1334, by May 1, 2020. There are a limited number of spots open.

li.span:
See our video to WCSD students and families by clicking the link below:
Video

Lunch/Breakfast pick ups: Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays via drive through at the Middle/High School from 11:30 am to 1:00 pm. This includes any child ages 0-18. If you have any questions regarding this change, please call 585-786-8000 ext. 1234.
Please see below for an updated message from Superintendent Matthew Wilkins. You can also find information and resources by visiting the "COVID-19 Updates" tab above.

a.title: Go to comments for Homepage Announcements

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: The Career Center at Warsaw Central School District, housed in the Middle/High School, will serve as the primary resource for helping students become college and career ready. Our goal is to aid in each student's career development, through career exploration, self-exploration, and career skill-building. This will occur through experiential education (job shadowing, interning, etc.), personal inventories (interests, skills, values, goals, etc.), and workshops geared toward specific career-related skill building. Special events and programs will also be held throughout the year, including career fairs, college admissions visits, business visits, and guest speakers. The Career Center provides assistance to students by appointment and on a walk-in basis.
